intro: Primula officinalis subf. tenuissima, commonly known as the narrow-leaved primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
